result.execSummary:
The defendant David W Oblak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STRAIGHT TIME.
Concurrent with: Counts 2 and 3, if revoked.

Court approves early termination of Probation after 18 months and all conditions have been met.
Concurrent with: Counts 2 and 3.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact wtih the victim K.A.O.  If the victim changes her position, the court will allow contact if she requests it.  Closing of home/property will need to be handled through defendant's attorney.
Court will allow upon presentation of proper receipt, firearms that are in present position at the Pewaukee Police Department may be turned over to Mr. Worden.  Mr. Worden will need to present copies of proper documentation to Pewaukee no later than 12-05-2015.
Court will allow defendant to have contact with the victim by text messaging or email only as to the sale of their home/property and to the repairs that need to be done.
Defendant is not to possess or use and firearms/weapons.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC

The defendant's firearms have been legally transferred to the Gary Worden and verified by receipt.  The subject firearms are identified as listed on the Village of Pewaukee Police Department Property Inventory and it is hereby ordered that the aforementioned identified firearms be released and returned forthwith to Gary Worden.  Signed and Filed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr. 10-06-2015.
with proposed order from hearing held on September 24, 2015 filed by Attorney Bucher.
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: September 24, 2015 Excerpt of Senencing Hearing filed by Linda Coleman.

Defendant David W Oblak in court with attorney Paul E Bucher.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNTS 1, 2 AND 3

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

6  MONTHS STRAIGHT TIME FOR COUNT 1, 30 DAYS EACH FOR COUNTS 2 and 3, ALL COUNTS CONCURRENT WITH EACH OTHER. 

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEAR(S) EACH COUNT CONCURRENT; AFTER 18 MONTHS, IF ALL CONDITIONS HAVE BEEN MET, THEN PROBATION MAY BE TERMINATED. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Absolute Sobriety;  
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment;
*No contact with victim, K.A.O. If victim changes her position, then court will allow contact if she requests it. Closing of home/property will need to be handled through defendant's attorney.   
*No weapons - no possession or use of firearms. 

Court will allow that upon presentation of proper receipt, firearms that are in present position at the Pewaukee Police Department may be turned over to Mr Worden with a receipt. However, Mr. Worden will need to present copies of proper documentation to Pewaukee no later than Monday, 10/5/15. 

Court will allow defendant to have contact with victim by text messaging or email only as to the sale of their home/property and to the repairs that need to be done only. 

COURT COSTS:  $353.00 (includes $100 DV assessment and $10.00 DRGOD assessment) for count 1, $243.00 each for counts 2 and 3, to be paid as a condition of probation;

Court orders doctors report that have been filed are to remain sealed.
with attached documents to be taken into consideration at sentencing.
Sentencing hearing on September 24, 2015 at 11:00 am.
